title: Subjunctive with Emotions
subtitle: Expressing feelings about others' actions
objectives: Express happiness, sadness, fear, and surprise
Distinguish when to use indicative vs subjunctive with emotions

screens.heading: Emotions + Que = Subjunctive
screens.content: When you express an emotion about someone else's action, use subjunctive after que:

examples.english: I'm glad (that) you're here
I'm sorry (that) you have to leave

examples.spanish: Me sorprende que no lo sepas
examples.english: It surprises me (that) you don't know

screens.tip: The emotion is your reaction to someone else's reality - hence subjunctive.

screens.heading: Common Emotion Verbs
screens.content: These verbs/expressions trigger subjunctive when followed by que:

examples.english: to be glad that
to be sorry that / regret that

examples.spanish: temer que / tener miedo de que
examples.english: to fear that
to be surprised that
to bother that
to love that
to hate that
to worry that

screens.heading: Gustar-Style Emotion Verbs
screens.content: Many emotion verbs work like GUSTAR (indirect object + verb):

examples.english: It makes me happy that you're coming
It bothers me that you arrive late
It worries me that you don't eat
We love that you visit us

screens.heading: Same Subject = Infinitive
screens.content: If the same person feels the emotion AND does the action, use infinitive (no que):

examples.english: I'm glad to be here (I'm glad, I'm here)
I'm sorry to arrive late (I'm sorry, I arrive late)
I fear not being able to go

examples.spanish: Es triste que no puedas venir
examples.english: It's sad that you can't come
It's wonderful that you're getting married

examples.spanish: Es terrible que haya tanta pobreza

Dear Pablo:

I'm very glad that things are going well at your new job. I'm surprised that they've already given you a promotion after only three months. It's incredible!

I'm very sorry that you can't come to my wedding. I understand that you're very busy. It saddens me that we're so far away now, but it excites me that you're planning to visit us in December.
